adjective.description: Capable of being harmonized or reconciled; reconcilable or compatible with something. Now rare.
Capable of being given, granted, or bestowed.

origin: Late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From accord + -able, partly after Anglo-Norman acordable, Anglo-Norman and Middle French, French accordable (of a person) affable, accommodating, well-suited, suitable, capable of being harmonized or reconciled.
